components.name: Publishing
components.description: Quick publish and posting related for all channels

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Sequence look up will happen from mongo 
A sequence can be stored in any db in mongo based on the load. 
{code}
Ex: POST_ID_SEQ and LINK_ID_SEQ belong to partner db. 
Earlier, these were stored in the same db. 
With the new change, these sequences can be stored in different dbs based on the load
{code}
Once a sequence is moved to a db in mongo, it cannot be moved to another db in mongo https://test.atlassian.net/wiki/display/ITOPS/Wordpress+setup 

Fallback dbs 
{code}
SPR_PARTNER_1_1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_1_-1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_1_1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_1_-1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_0_1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_0_1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_GLOBAL
{code}

The server configuration is saved in mongoSettings in global mongo
fields.summary: Sequence look up from mongo based on the load

comments.body:
Explanation for Server configuration for sequence to mongo 
1.There are 4 dbs created 
{code}
stagingDefault:PRIMARY> db.serverConfiguration.find({serverType:"SEQUENCE_FACTORY", serverCategory:"MONGO"}).pretty()
{
	"_id" : ObjectId("5803ae8e3e376e3c9d745e94"),
	"partnerId" : -1,
	"clientId" : -1,
	"serverCategory" : "MONGO",
	"serverType" : "SEQUENCE_FACTORY",
	"name" : "MONGO-SEQUENCE_FACTORY-SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_GLOBAL",
	"sequenceName" : "GLOBAL",
	"dbName" : "SPR_GLOBAL_SEQUENCE",
	"mongoServerId" : "SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_GLOBAL",
	"url" : "10.0.1.130:53421,10.0.2.7:53421",
	"user" : "sprmys"
}
{
	"_id" : ObjectId("5803aea63e376e3c9d745e97"),
	"partnerId" : 0,
	"clientId" : -1,
	"serverCategory" : "MONGO",
	"serverType" : "SEQUENCE_FACTORY",
	"name" : "MONGO-SEQUENCE_FACTORY-SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_LINK_ID_SEQ",
	"sequenceName" : "LINK_ID_SEQ",
	"dbName" : "SPR_PARTNER0_-1_LINK_ID_SEQ",
	"mongoServerId" : "SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_LINK_ID_SEQ",
	"url" : "10.0.1.130:53421,10.0.2.7:53421",
	"user" : "sprmys"
}
{
	"_id" : ObjectId("5803ae9e3e376e3c9d745e96"),
	"partnerId" : 0,
	"clientId" : -1,
	"serverCategory" : "MONGO",
	"serverType" : "SEQUENCE_FACTORY",
	"name" : "MONGO-SEQUENCE_FACTORY-SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_POST_ID_SEQ",
	"sequenceName" : "POST_ID_SEQ",
	"dbName" : "SPR_PARTNER0_POST_ID_SEQ",
	"mongoServerId" : "SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_POST_ID_SEQ",
	"url" : "10.0.1.130:53421,10.0.2.7:53421",
	"user" : "sprmys"
}
{
	"_id" : ObjectId("5803afb73e376e3c9d745e98"),
	"partnerId" : 3,
	"clientId" : -1,
	"serverCategory" : "MONGO",
	"serverType" : "SEQUENCE_FACTORY",
	"name" : "MONGO-SEQUENCE_FACTORY-SPR_PARTNER_3_-1_CASE_MANAGEMENT_ID_SEQ",
	"sequenceName" : "CASE_MANAGEMENT_ID_SEQ",
	"dbName" : "SPR_PARTNER3_CASE_MANAGEMENT_ID_SEQ",
	"mongoServerId" : "SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_GLOBAL",
	"url" : "10.0.1.130:53421,10.0.2.7:53421",
	"user" : "sprmys"
}
{code}

2.The look up from mongo happens in this order from the "dbName" 
Example 1: POST_ID_SEQ
{code}
If there is a "dbName"  contains POST_ID_SEQ, the look up will first start there. In this case from SPR_PARTNER0_POST_ID_SEQ
{code}
Example 2 : ACCOUNT_ID_SEQ
{code}
The search starts with "dbName" containing ACCOUNT_ID_SEQ. If not found , it searches in Global db. In this case from SPR_GLOBAL_SEQUENCE
{code}
3.The generic fallback will be in this order. 
{code}
SPR_PARTNER_1_1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_1_-1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_1_1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_1_-1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_0_1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_POST_ID_SEQ
SPR_PARTNER_0_1_GLOBAL
SPR_PARTNER_0_-1_GLOBAL
{code}
4. The server configuration is saved in sequenceSettings in global mongo
5.The list of sequences is save in 
{code}
alias : sequenceMongoCon -1
collection :sequenceConfigurationBean 
{code}

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1muR48dInlkhhm6GfOdGNBXM-zpzgTOiHVxXbNUH681U/edit#gid=1913067576
The result is being tracked here
Migration of POST_ID_SEQ and LINK_ID_SEQ done in NQA
Migration of POST_ID_SEQ done in prod and the logs are being monitored by ITOPS
Migration of LINK_ID_SEQ done in prod and the logs are being monitored by ITOPS
